questions.question_text:
You manage a Dynamics 365 environment. You plan to implement business process flows from AppSource.
You need to ensure that a user can install the business process flows.
What should you do?

You need to ensure that a user named User1 can assign salespeople to sales territories. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.
To which security role should you assign User1?

comments.content: Interested to know why you think that? what permissions are you comparing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Because I have to ensure that a user1 can assign salespeople to sales territories. So, I should have access to users and their security roles.
D is the answer as system customizer cant assign sales people to sales territories.

The correct answer is C - "Make sure that you have the Manager, Vice President, CEO-Business Manager, System Administrator, or System Customizer security role or equivalent permissions." Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/set-up-sales-territories-organize-business-markets-geographical-area

Important: Out of the box (default) security roles required to create Sales Territories and assign a salesperson to Sales Territories are Account Manager, Sales Manager, Vice President of Sales, CEO-Business Manager, System Administrator security role or equivalent permissions.

The System customizer security role cannot create a sales territory but can read and write (modify) it. Also, System customizer cannot assign a salesperson (user) to a sales territory.

Please test this in your Dynamics 365 Sales App.

comments.content: Read also here for confirmation (CEO is the right answer): https://community.learnmsdynamics.com/post/configure-sales-territories-in-microsoft-dynamics-365-5f118058355f047613ad553b

discussion.content: In this link (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/set-up-sales-territories-organize-business-markets-geographical-area) seems that Manager, Vice President, CEO-Business Manager, System Administrator, or System Customizer are able to do that.

The question states that "The solution must use the principle of least privilege"
The link below tell us that we must Make sure that we have the Manager, Vice President, CEO-Business Manager, System Administrator, or System Customizer security role or equivalent permissions
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/set-up-sales-territories-organize-business-markets-geographical-area

Hence "C" is the correct answer
